pageContext.description:
St Jerome is shown sitting at a makeshift table in the wilderness. There is an open book on the table as well as a crucifix. Although his status is  betrayed by the cardinal's vestments, he is shown with a naked torso and his grey beard hangs down in long swathes. In the expansive landscape behind a caravan of pack animals is shown arriving at a building.
[Görres, cda 2016]

tests.text:
DESCRIPTION

Tools/Material: 
- fluid, black medium, brush; an initial rough design in dark chalk 

Type/Ductus: 
- freehand, very sketchy underdrawing 
- thin to somewhat broader lines 

Function: 
- only roughly binding for the final painted version; lines delineate the main contours and describe essential details and facial features; no representation of volume with hatching strokes

Deviations: 
- numerous corrections were made to forms during the painting process; changes (e. g.  various buildings and landscape elements in the background; the figure of the saint.)

INTERPRETATION

Attribution: 
- Lucas Cranach the Elder or workshop 

Comments:
- there was probably a pre-existing design in the workshop 
[Sandner, Smith-Contini, Heydenreich, cda 2018]

pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia on the left support of the table: winged serpent with elevated wings facing left; in black paint.

[Pérez Simón Collection, revised 2013]
